tungfuguru
children.comment: Thanks Jane! So Google got substance right but the I / you bit wrong.
He wrote "You know nothing, Snow-san" ("Kimi wa nani mo shiranai yo ne, jon snoh")
OK so may we please know your translation of what you did actually write, so we may compare?
Well, what I meant by that was "People pay me to translate Japanese, because Google Translate sure as hell doesn't know how." :)
Google is the only reason most of us know anything, Rikoshi-san :)
Google Translate is the reason I have a job (that job being professional Japanese translator).

children.author: JuicyRhino
children.comment: Unfortunately, Google translate isn't the most reliable translator out there, especially for Japanese. The markers make it kinda wonky.
Google translate says: "I'm do not know anything, you are John Snow"
「君は何も知らないよね、ジョン・スノー」
